question: My mom? Oh, no! What's she doing here?
answer: Jeremiah! Jeremiah Bruce! You get out here this instant!

question: Oh, hi, mom.
answer: NOW!

question: What's up?
answer: The devil's body count, that's what's up! Don't you know what KISS stands for? "Knights in Satan's Service!"

question: Lex, quit trying to always jinx things. Don't worry, dudes. Nobody's missing that concert tomorrow night.
answer: Hello?

question: Jam, listen up.
answer: Hawk?

question: Just listen up, man, cause we are in a quandary. Are you on the crapper with one of those antenna phones? Sounds like you're taking a dump the size of Butte, Montana.
answer: It's my Bullworker.

question: Anyway, listen up. They're gone!
answer: What's gone?

question: The KISS tickets, you nimrod! They're just fuckin' gone! Please tell me you have'm!
answer: Gone!? Why would I have the KISS tick...?

question: Just check whatever you were wearing last night. Now!
answer: Whew! Oh, God, Hawk... I got'm! Somehow I musta taken Trip's jacket by mistake!

question: He's got'm! Trip, he took your jacket by mistake. You must be wearing Jam's. Cool.
answer: I'm really sorry about that, man.

question: Don't be a fembot. So, are you like grounded because of last night, or what?
answer: Of course, but has that ever stopped me before? Besides, my mom's going to some church meeting and won't be back till late. No sweat... See you guys in school.

question: Jeremiah, what are you doing?
answer: Uhh... nothing. Ahh, sunshine.

question: You're going to be late if you don't hurry up and change soon.
answer: Change? What's wrong with what I got on?

question: It's dirty laundry for one thing and for another, you still haven't worn the clothes I bought you. You're skating on thin ice already, young man, so I wouldn't push my luck. Now get out of those rags.
answer: But, mom!

question: Besides, those jeans are so tight I can see your penis. Someday you'll see the futility in forging a musical career with those idiots.
answer: They're not idiots.

question: Now don't forget you're on the honor system tonight. I'll be home a little after one and if you've been partying or playing that satanic KISS music... well, need I remind you of the consequences?
answer: Grounded for the rest of the year?

question: Stellas. I hate stellas almost as much as I hate dogs.
answer: Same species when you think about it.

question: Yeah, right. She wishes. Look at that big ass.
answer: You know what they say about a big ass... big shit. Hey, that dork looks just like Jam.

question: Don't worry about it. They're perfectly safe. We can pick them up after school. My mom won't be home. It's no problem.
answer: All right. After school we double- time it to your house for the tix before heading to the train station for the 2:45 to Detroit Rock City.

question: Check.
answer: As they say in the Tampon biz, see you next period.

question: Oof! Sorry.
answer: No problem.

question: Thanks. Beth?
answer: Yes?

question: Ow!
answer: No. No problem.

question: Just a little pink eye. No reason to panic.
answer: Sorry.

question: It's okay.
answer: Jeremiah?

question: Yeah?
answer: I wanted to tell you something...

question: I made an appointment with Father Phillip McNulty at St. Bernard's. We're to see him directly where he will register you on the spot.
answer: You mean, you're sending me to... b- b-boarding school?

question: What else can I do? Oh, records and magazines and comic books are one thing, but tickets? TICKETS? Jeremiah, do you realize what this means? That you're no longer content merely hearing their awful songs or looking at photos of their horrific faces! Now you want to see the devil in the flesh. You want to reach out and touch pure evil... and in Detroit no less!
answer: Mom, three of those tickets don't even belong to me. They're for the guys.

question: Fuck! Shit!
answer: Hey, take it easy, man. This is the girls' crapper, remember?

question: Wake up, Lex! We just watched Jam's mom torch our fuckin' KISS tickets! Not REO Speedwagon! Not Journey! Not the Bay City Rollers! KISS! If you can think of a better reason to trash a bathroom, I'd sure like to hear it!
answer: Trip, it's not the end of the world, okay? Quit acting all squeezed out.

question: Oh, everything's hunky-dory now that the shit hit the fan just like you said it would, you snug sonofabitch! You fuckin' jinxed us!
answer: Smug, Trip! Not snug, smug.

question: Smug, Trip! Not snug, smug.
answer: We're clear, dudes. A skirt just came around the corner. That's Sherry VanHafton.

question: I've been in love with her since the second grade.
answer: Whoa... she just farted.

question: I have never heard a girl squeeze cheese in my entire life.
answer: Weird...

question: Someday you'll have a son just like you, Jeremiah. A boy who lies through his teeth, buys demonic records, and smokes the dope just like you.
answer: If I'm anything like you, I'll deserve him.

question: What?!
answer: I said, I'm sorry!

question: If you truly are sorry, son, then you better pray like you've never prayed before. God willed me to find those tickets because He wanted to hear from you. He knows you need help and He wants you to ask Him for it.
answer: Please, God, help.

question: Our band "Mystery" is a quartet and we can't go on the road without our drummer. Jam's mom said something about sending him to St. Bernard's, right? We gotta bust him out before we go anywhere.
answer: But... but, St. Bernard's is way the hell over in the next county!

question: So? Your mom's car has a CB, radar detector and cruise control, check?
answer: We are not stealing my mom's car.

question: Damn straight we are.
answer: Hawk, all I need is one ding on the Volvo and presto! There are my balls hanging from the rearview mirror after she gets back from Cincinnati.

question: And when is she due back from that groinecologist's convention anyway?
answer: Sunday, but...

question: So then, the younger one says, "But dad... I've been helping you on the farm my entire life! You never once slaughtered the fatted calf for me!" And then... Forgive me, Jeremiah, it's just that... I've been telling this gospel for years and... I just now realized it's the work of some comedy mastermind! The Prodigal Son is a barrel of fucking monkeys!
answer: It's okay, we're old buds of Father McNulty... How's it hangin', padre?

question: A little to the right, pizza fellow.
answer: That was another dude. Anyway, we're here to take our bud Jam to the big satanic KISS concert tonight. Okay with you?

question: Lex, am I gonna have to lock you in the trunk till we reach Detroit? Don't worry, these babies are built for speed.
answer: I'm starvin' and it's way past lunchtime.

question: Totally. All I've had for chow was a packet of Pop Rocks and a Yoo-hoo.
answer: Let's stop in Sandusky, Hawk.

question: What's in Sandusky?
answer: Pizza, and I been jones-in' for a pizza ever since we left St. Bernard's.

question: Do you realize the sheer, goddamn, unadulterated, undiluted, no holds barred, one hundred percent pure as Ivory Snow, absolutely friggin' STUPIDITY of what you just did?
answer: Hey, disco dude, it's cool...

question: DO YOU?! Lemme paint you a friggin' picture ahright? Imagine if you will a 1978 Pontiac Trans American in pristine condition. An appealing portrait, nesspah? BUT WAIT! What's that spec on the windshield? Could it be a wad of melted mozzarella, tangy tomato sauce, and various friggin' meat products?
answer: Could be.

question: Shut-up, Christine!
answer: Okay, Kenny? I don't mean to drain your keg or anything, but could you speed up this process? Don't get me wrong, we'd love to stand here and get shit on by the cast of Saturday Night Fever, but we're also on a schedule. So step on it.

question: Are you gettin' wise with me?
answer: No, I'm dumber than a goddamn slug. Now can I please clean your windshield and leave without further ado?

question: Kool and the Gang, now there's real music. But this... is crap! So. All that having been said and done, I believe we are ready for the final topic of discussion. Namely
answer: Well, let's recap, shall we? You slapped all of us, yelled at me, used my head for a rag, threw me on the ground and tossed our LOVE GUN 8- track under the wheels of a passing semi. So, if the lesson was that you're a dick with ears and a really bad haircut, then, yes... I'd say we learned it.

question: Excuse me, I'm a little deef-a- hearin'. Can you repeat yourself?
answer: Okay. Ahem! You. Are. A. Dick. With. Ears. And. A. Really. Bad. Haircut.

question: Oh, yeah...? That's not what your mother said last night.
answer: It's not, huh? Well, then, tell me... ...what exactly did my mother say last night? You heard me, prick. What did my mother say last night?

question: Okay, fagmo... I'll tell you what your mother said last night. She said that I was the fuck of her life.
answer: How would you like a nice Hawaiian Punch?

question: Oh, quit bein' the wussy, sensitive guy to impress her, Jam. She's obviously not gonna put out. She's a fuckin' tease.
answer: Tease? What the hell did I do to tease you mongoloids?

question: You got in the car, didn't you?
answer: Oh, God, how calculating of me to lead you all on like that after you offered me a ride in the middle of nowhere.

question: Whatever... stella.
answer: The name's Christine, not stella. And there's no need to be such pigs just cause I prefer Donna Summer or KC and the Sunshine Boys or the Village People over KISS?

question: Now there's an intelligently biting remark wrought with wit and irony.
answer: Hey, if you don't like that one, maybe you'll think it's funny when we throw your ass out the goddamn car!

question: Yeah, why don't you put your money where your mouth is?
answer: Why don't you kiss my hairy crack?

question: Simple Simon on the Rock, go caller.
answer: Hello? Is this me? I'm Trip. Am I on the air?

question: I should hang up on you right now, but you're the right caller so answer quick or get your battleship sunk. What are the names of the four members of KISS?
answer: Gene Klein, Stanley Eisen, Paul Frehley, and Peter...Criscula! Yeah, that's it!

question: Is that your final answer?
answer: Yeah.

question: Trip? You just got yourself four tickets and four backstage passes to KISS live at Cobo Hall tonight!
answer: I did?

question: Yeah, you did!
answer: Yeeeehaaawww!! This is totally fuckin' curly, man! Thank you God!

question: Oh, I'm sorry, Trip. What you made was a big, brainless, pile of horse shit. No offense.
answer: Guys, GUYS! Come on, if this is anyone's fault, it's mine. I was the one who grabbed Trip's jacket by mistake. It's my fault and I apologize.

question: Please, Jam, we're trying to vent some hostility here. Sure the whole thing may be your fault, but who's gonna get pissed off at you?
answer: Sometimes I think I don't deserve friends as good as you guys.

question: Jam, not another word out of your femmy-ass mouth! Okay, we're here, we got nothing, and we got an hour and a half. We're totally committed. It's time to brainstorm.
answer: Here's a suggestion. Let's stop worrying about the concert for the time being and get the cops in on this Volvo situation.

question: Wake up, Lex. This is Detroit. The cops aren't gonna waste city dollars looking for a Swedish car. Face it, the Volvo's on a cutting board as we speak getting sliced, diced, and julienned by Christine, the chop shop gourmet. Now listen up. Here's the game plan.
answer: ...I mean, my mom's got insurance. What's the worst thing she could do? Ground me for the entire year? I can handle that...

question: Cool, bro, now listen up...
answer: ...Holy shit! I am in absolute trouble! I never should have let you drive, man! Absolute fuckin' trouble!

question: Brilliance, Trip. Sheer brilliance. Give Albert Einstein here the Nobel Prize.
answer: I think we should try sneaking in.

question: Four dudes sneaking in? We'd get busted fer sure. Bad plan.
answer: Okay, one of us sneaks in, gets four ticket stubs off some kids in the audience, comes back out, and we all "re-enter" the concerto. Voila!

question: For the next hour and a half it's every dude for himself. Try to get at least one ticket and at 8:30 P.M. we'll meet over there.
answer: Wait! I know how we can get in!

question: Jam, shut-up! You're not allowed to speak, remember? Go use whatever femmy idea you have to get yourself a ticket or four. I don't wanna hear it.
answer: But... my plan involves all four of us acting together.

question: See you at 8:30, Jam. Later. Dudes? Later.
answer: Oh... dear... Lord!!

question: Second row center, seventy-five clams.
answer: Dude, this is all I got.

question: Sorry, man, no can do. But I'll be here for a while if you scare up the extra gravy.
answer: Where the hell am I gonna scare up that kinda gravy in one hour?

question: The easy way. You look a little scrawny, but it's worth a shot.
answer: I can't just walk in and take my clothes off. It's embarrasskin.

question: Guess you don't want to see the greatest show on earth. And in Detroit no less. Well, take care, chief.
answer: Dude, if it were dancing the way Fred Astaire did it, I'd give it my best shot. I'd learn the steps and practice in my spare time. But this... tribal, ritualistic bullshit, it's way-too-spontaneous for me.

question: Yeah, you're probably too young anyhow.
answer: Hey, I invented fake I.D.s, alright. That's not the problem... They're playing disco music in there, man.

question: Like to sign up for the contest.
answer: You're a little scrawny, but thanks to the concert we're low on amateurs. Name?

question: Hawk.
answer: Pick a song, Hawk.

question: Got any KISS?
answer: You kidding? This is Detroit. Drink?

question: Yeah, a man's drink... ...Dickey. I'm gonna need all the help I can get tonight. What's that?
answer: You mean you never seen a Jack Daniels on the rocks before?

question: Sure, I have. But not one with ice in it, that's all.
answer: Save your money, stud muffin. The lady at the end of the bar sends her love.

question: Whoa... she is a killer.
answer: Amanda Finch. Her ex is one of the wealthiest businessmen in Detroit. Play your cards right and you could hit paydirt. She like 'em young. And since you look a little new at this, let me give you three words of advice. Hard to get. Think it, act it, know it, be it. Nothing a woman loves more than when you beat her at her own head games.

question: Hey, you little twerps, gimme your KISS tickets or I'll pop your fuckin' faces in. I oughta kick your asses for sayin' that. But I'm in a hurry so I'll just take this instead. Now scram. Hey, little kid.
answer: Shit! You just skunked my last ball, you...

question: Okay, booger, your KISS ticket or your life. Hunh? Oh. Okay... But scream and you'll never live to see puberty. I'll pop your fuckin' face in.
answer: Please sir, don't beat me up. I do have a KISS ticket, but not on me.

question: A likely story. Hand it over, kid.
answer: No really. My brother's hanging onto it for safe keeping. Please, let me get him for you. Hey, Chongo!

question: Hey, kid, that's okay. I don't wanna see KISS that ba...
answer: Don't try to run, maggot. Chongo's an all-state track star in every event.

question: What do you want?
answer: A tag on your toe. Nobody threatens me and lives.

question: Look, you can have my wallet...
answer: It's not nearly enough, punk. Besides, I was gonna take your wallet anyway. After Chongo and his friends crush your ribcage like a pack of Luckys.

question: Uh, next mass isn't until tomorrow morning, young lady. Run along now.
answer: Now it's been a while since my boy had holy confession. Could you...?

question: Consider it done.
answer: It's about time you gave up on that stupid dream once and for all. No son of mine is going to be a career musician. Thank you, Father. I'll be back for him before you know it; after I take care of some unfinished business.

question: Oh, Dicky, I c-c-can't...
answer: You're not gonna chicken out on me now, are you? We've got your KISS song playing and everything.

question: I-I c-can't...
answer: Look, people undress in public because, A, they're exhibitionists, B, they're nutcases, or C, they need the money. I can tell you're not A, and I hope to hell you're not B. So my suggestion is, think about why you're a C and let your body party, shake your groove thing, boogie oogie oogie till you just can't boogie no more.

question: Two hundred bucks?
answer: You heard me, nad breath. My time's precious and I think that's a reasonable price to pay for your sorry life.

question: Look, I want to live, but I don't know where the fuck I'm gonna find two hundred bucks.
answer: Chongo? Take him outside and tear his ass out through his mouth.

question: So, you see if it wasn't for me, me and my friends would be at that KISS concert right now... together.
answer: That's it?

question: Yeah.
answer: Well, this is a unique confession to say the least, son. And not exactly the most interesting one I've ever heard either. You sure you don't want to talk about... oh, carnal knowledge with a neighborhood girl or impure thoughts about the new student teacher maybe... or how about finding a box of magazines under your dad's bed?

question: No.
answer: Well then, I suggest you have a seat on the bench behind you and think of something a little juicier to confess than losing KISS tickets. I realize this is Detroit, but I personally find, what that rock and roll band is all about, to be boring as Lucifer's kingdom. I'll return in a little while.

question: Beth? I can't believe it.
answer: Believe it.

question: Are you waiting for confession? I thought you were Jewish?
answer: I have a confession. Here it is. I didn't mean for that to be so... intense. Forgive me.

question: I don't care. I wanna hear more.
answer: I've loved you ever since I first laid eyes on you, Jeremiah. I've just always been too scared to show it.

question: Beth, I can't believe you just said that because that's exactly how I've always felt about you... Call me Jam. It's my band name.
answer: You don't know how long I've been waiting to hear that... Jam! We've got to take this slow...

question: Right, slow...
answer: Oh, screw it!

question: Thanks, miss.
answer: You're too kind. I'm Amanda.

question: Right, well, thanks for the drinks and stuff, Amanda, but there's no reason for me to stick around these parts anymore.
answer: Don't be so glum, Hawk. The night's still young and filled with plenty of compensatory possibilities.

question: Huh?
answer: I'd be in a position to spend some money on you if you'd get in a position and spend some time on me.

question: Alright, everybody, SHUT UP! Okay, bro. You gonna have to do this sometime. Might as well be now.
answer: Evening, honey. Y'know what I am, what this is, and what you have to do, so do it quick. The rest of you kindly introduce yourselves to the floor and kiss it hello. Do or die, bitch! Next time I let the barrels do the talking. Fuck school, that's what I say! I just went through the motions till I was old enough to drop out and I'm leaving here with at least two fifty the easy way. Look where all that studying's gonna get you tonight. Robbed at gunpoint and possibly shot in the fucking head... for minimum wage!

question: Alright, drop it or I'll kick your ass!
answer: Oh, yeah! You and what army?

question: So. Is it true that Gene Simmons had a cow's tongue grafted onto his real one? Y'know, to make it so long?
answer: I dunno. I think he had the piece of skin under his tongue removed so he could stick it out farther. I'm not too up on Gene trivia.

question: Your man is the drummer, Peter Criss, right?
answer: Peter Criss is my inspiration, man. If I paid a hundred bucks for a KISS show and all I saw was his solo, I'd consider it... money... Hey, how'd you know that?

question: I have all your notebook doodles memorized, Jam... Here.
answer: Ann Arbor?

question: Okay, you better have something really sinful for me this time, son. My patience is worn to threads and your mom will be here any minute.
answer: Alright, Father, here it is. About two weeks ago I went to my cousin's wedding and one of the bridesmaids asked me if I wanted to take a bath.

question: No...
answer: I was insulted, so I asked her if I was wreaking some wicked b.o., right? Then she said no, she wanted to take a bath with me.

question: Oh, this is terrible... Please go on.
answer: Well, she was a very tempting siren, Father. Built like you wouldn't believe. So I gave into temptation about a block away from the wedding reception at this little motel that charges by the hour.

question: Well? Continue! Continue!
answer: Okay... when she peeled off that gown, you'll never guess what she was wearing underneath.

question: Was it a teddy?
answer: No. Much bet... I mean, much more sinful than that.

question: A bustier?
answer: Tell you what. You keep guessing and I'll say something when you get it.

question: Thanks. What the hell is that?
answer: Gin.

question: Whoa. Some of this hard liquor's a tad too manly for me. I'm a brewski man myself.
answer: Better ease up then, Hawk. Wouldn't want to give you whiskey dick would we?

question: Who's Whiskey Dick?
answer: Well. Obviously no one you have to worry about... Woody.

question: My name's not Woody, it's Haw-haw... ...holy shit!
answer: But you do know Premature Peter, don't you? Shame, I just bought these stockings.

question: Well, Amanda, this has been quite a night. So far you've seen me and my dick throw up. What's next? Projectile diarrhea? Man. What a stud, huh?
answer: Believe it or not, you still have a way to go before you start competing with my soon-to-be-ex-husband... the champion of lousy lovemaking. The man who thinks he's the biggest and the best... The man who thinks every secretary, stewardess, and cocktail waitress he fucks should lick his feet for the honor. The man for whom faking it was invented. Christ, if I hadn't gotten pregnant with our son, I would have never known I even had sex with the prick.

question: You love him?
answer: I just told you, he's a big, hairy...

question: No, I mean... you love your son?
answer: More than anything in the world.

question: And he loves you back, doesn't he?
answer: He's a little spoiled, but I know he does.

question: Well, shame on him if he doesn't.
answer: You're sweet.

question: Gimme your gun, boy!
answer: No, you gimme your gun, boy!

question: Don't tempt me, I'll shoot!
answer: Not if I shoot first!

question: I don't even think you have a gun!
answer: Neither do I!

question: Now, for the last time, take the piece out and lay back down or your mom's gonna need the White Tornado to get the brains outta your ski cap.
answer: Smile, you sonofa... Call me... Dr. Love!

question: Ann Arbor isn't... that far from Cleveland, right?
answer: Nah. Once I get my own wheels, I could come up all the time.

question: That'd be great. Hey, maybe someday your band'll play there. It's a college town, you know?
answer: I feel like such an idiot. Why didn't I just say something a year and a half ago? Man, think of how much time we wasted.

question: Let's not think about the past. Let's just think about from today on. I'll never forget you, Jam.
answer: Tell me about it. Church will never be the same again.

question: Coming dad. I'll call you. Soon as we get a phone. Bye.
answer: Bye.

question: I'm gonna ask you nicely first. Mom, can I have my drumsticks back? Again, can I have my drumsticks?
answer: Drumsticks are the least of your worries, young man. You are in a world of...

question: I know, mom, I've been in trouble for about twelve hours now! Hellooooo!? I'm gonna be spending the next two years of my life at St. Bernard's Boarding School, remember?! I'm gonna be outta your hair till I'm a legal adult, remember?! That way, all you have to do is go to church, light a candle, pray to a little statue for me, and voila! All is forgiven and forgotten, right mom?!! Then, you can spend your days in guilt-free pursuit of more constructive activities like telling everybody else how screwed up their lives are! That way you no longer need the patience and understanding required to communicate on some normal level with your own child!!! And that way you don't even have to think about how tough it was for you when you were growing up, and it's a good thing too. Cause if you did, you'd realize what a LOUSY, GODDAMN, SHITTY- ASS, PARENT YOU ARE!!!
answer: Jeremiah... what's gotten into you?

question: Well... I still got my idea if anybody will let me speak.
answer: Go ahead, Jam.

question: We all beat each other up, then, once we're nice and bruised, we run over to the ticket takers and say we got mugged and our tickets were stolen. They gotta let us in then.
answer: Dude, you gotta let us in! Four muggers just stole our tickets!
